title: Facebook reportedly gets a $5 billion slap on the wrist from the FTC
text: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission has reportedly agreed to end its latest probe into Facebook‘s privacy problems with a $5 billion payout. According to The Wall Street Journal, the 3-2, party-line vote by FTC commissioners was carried by the Republican majority and will be moved to the Justice Department’s civil division to be finalized.

title: Facebook's $5 billion fine a record for the FTC, says WSJ reporter

title: Facebook to be fined $5bn for Cambridge Analytica privacy violations – reports

title: Facebook stock hits highest price in nearly a year after reports of $5 billion FTC fine
text: Facebook Inc. shares closed at their highest price in nearly a year Friday after reports that the Federal Trade Commission has approved a $5 billion fine, a record amount that would still be less than a quarter of Facebook’s annual profit.

title: U.S. regulators approve $5 billion Facebook settlement over privacy issues: source
text: The U.S. Federal Trade Commission approved a roughly $5 billion settlement with Facebook Inc  this week over its investigation into the social media company's handling of user data, a source familiar with the situation said on Friday.

title: F.T.C. Approves Facebook Fine of About $5 Billion
text: If approved by the Justice Department, the settlement would be the biggest fine levied by the federal government against a technology company.

title: Facebook shares rise on report of $5B settlement with FTC
text: The Federal Trade Commission has reportedly slapped Facebook with a record-setting $5 billion fine over its privacy lapses, including a massive data leak to political research firm Cambridge Analytica. The staggering penalty, which was approved on a 3-2 vote with Republicans in support of it and Democrats against, according to the Wall Street Journal (paywall),.
